class.name: Word.Shape
class.description: Represents a shape in the header, footer, or document body. Currently, only the following shapes are supported: text boxes, geometric shapes, groups, pictures, and canvases.

properties.name: allowOverlap
properties.description: Specifies whether a given shape can overlap other shapes.

properties.name: altTextDescription
properties.description: Specifies a string that represents the alternative text associated with the shape.

properties.name: body
properties.description: Represents the body object of the shape. Only applies to text boxes and geometric shapes.

properties.name: canvas
properties.description: Gets the canvas associated with the shape. An object with its `isNullObject` property set to `true` will be returned if the shape type isn't "Canvas". For further information, see [*OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: fill
properties.description: Returns the fill formatting of the shape.

properties.name: geometricShapeType
properties.description: The geometric shape type of the shape. It will be null if isn't a geometric shape.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height, in points, of the shape.

properties.name: heightRelative
properties.description: The percentage of shape height to vertical relative size, see [Word.RelativeSize](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.relativesize). For an inline or child shape, it can't be set.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Gets an integer that represents the shape identifier.

properties.name: isChild
properties.description: Check whether this shape is a child of a group shape or a canvas shape.

properties.name: left
properties.description: The distance, in points, from the left side of the shape to the horizontal relative position, see [Word.RelativeHorizontalPosition](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.relativehorizontalposition). For an inline shape, it will return 0 and can't be set. For a child shape in a canvas or group, it's relative to the top left corner.

properties.name: leftRelative
properties.description: The relative left position as a percentage from the left side of the shape to the horizontal relative position, see [Word.RelativeHorizontalPosition](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.relativehorizontalposition). For an inline or child shape, it will return 0 and can't be set.

properties.name: lockAspectRatio
properties.description: Specifies if the aspect ratio of this shape is locked.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the shape.

properties.name: parentCanvas
properties.description: Gets the top-level parent canvas shape of this child shape. It will be null if it isn't a child shape of a canvas.

properties.name: parentGroup
properties.description: Gets the top-level parent group shape of this child shape. It will be null if it isn't a child shape of a group.

properties.name: relativeHorizontalPosition
properties.description: The relative horizontal position of the shape. For an inline shape, it can't be set. For details, see [Word.RelativeHorizontalPosition](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.relativehorizontalposition).

properties.name: relativeHorizontalSize
properties.description: The relative horizontal size of the shape. For an inline or child shape, it can't be set. For details, see [Word.RelativeHorizontalPosition](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.relativehorizontalposition).

properties.name: relativeVerticalPosition
properties.description: The relative vertical position of the shape. For an inline shape, it can't be set. For details, see [Word.RelativeVerticalPosition](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.relativeverticalposition).

properties.name: relativeVerticalSize
properties.description: The relative vertical size of the shape. For an inline or child shape, it can't be set. For details, see [Word.RelativeHorizontalPosition](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.relativehorizontalposition).

properties.name: rotation
properties.description: Specifies the rotation, in degrees, of the shape. Not applicable to Canvas shape.

properties.name: shapeGroup
properties.description: Gets the shape group associated with the shape. An object with its isNullObject property set to true will be returned if the shape type isn't "GroupShape". For further information, see [*OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

properties.name: textFrame
properties.description: Gets the text frame object of the shape.

properties.name: textWrap
properties.description: Returns the text wrap formatting of the shape.

properties.name: top
properties.description: The distance, in points, from the top edge of the shape to the vertical relative position (see [Word.RelativeVerticalPosition](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.relativeverticalposition)). For an inline shape, it will return 0 and can't be set. For a child shape in a canvas or group, it's relative to the top left corner.

properties.name: topRelative
properties.description: The relative top position as a percentage from the top edge of the shape to the vertical relative position, see [Word.RelativeVerticalPosition](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.relativeverticalposition). For an inline or child shape, it will return 0 and can't be set.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Gets the shape type. Currently, only the following shapes are supported: text boxes, geometric shapes, groups, pictures, and canvases.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Specifies if the shape is visible. Not applicable to inline shapes.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width, in points, of the shape.

properties.name: widthRelative
properties.description: The percentage of shape width to horizontal relative size, see [Word.RelativeSize](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.relativesize). For an inline or child shape, it can't be set.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the shape and its content.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

methods.name: moveHorizontally
methods.description: Moves the shape horizontally by the number of points.

methods.name: moveVertically
methods.description: Moves the shape vertically by the number of points.

methods.name: scaleHeight
methods.description: Scales the height of the shape by a specified factor. For images, you can indicate whether you want to scale the shape relative to the original or the current size. Shapes other than pictures are always scaled relative to their current height.

methods.name: scaleWidth
methods.description: Scales the width of the shape by a specified factor. For images, you can indicate whether you want to scale the shape relative to the original or the current size. Shapes other than pictures are always scaled relative to their current height.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.Shape object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.ShapeData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.
